column1: The '''''Eruhantalë''''' was the last of the [[Three Prayers]] to [[Ilúvatar
column2: Eru]] spoken each year by the [[King of Númenor
column4: Queen]] of [[Númenor]]. In this ceremony, the monarch and his or her people gave thanks to Eru. It was held at the end of each autumn. During the ''Eruhantalë'', the King or Queen would ascend the [[Meneltarma]], accompanied by a silent, white-clad crowd of people. The ruler would make a prayer and a bloodless offering on the mountain's summit, while three great [[Eagles]], the [[Witnesses of Manwë]], hovered overhead.<ref name=N>{{UT

column1: ''Eruhantalë'' means 'Thanksgiving to Eru' in [[Quenya]] (from the word ''[[hantalë]]'', meaning 'thanksgiving').<ref name=N/>
